snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey vetoed the bill conditionally, suggesting a list of changes. Lawmakers had unanimously passed the bill to improve the state’s management of Hurricane Sandy recovery.
abstract: Gov Chris Christie of New Jersey vetoes bill that lawmakers had unanimously passed to improve the state’s management of Hurricane Sandy recovery; measure, known as the Sandy Bill of Rights, would have required the state to allocate federal aid to cities and towns based on how much damage they had suffered in the storm; he suggests a long list of changes he says would improve the proposal.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey vetoed the bill conditionally, suggesting a list of changes. Lawmakers had unanimously passed the bill to improve the state’s management of Hurricane Sandy recovery.

headline.main: Christie Vetoes Bill to Improve Storm Recovery Effort; Big Mistake, Top Senator Says
headline.print_headline: Christie Vetoes Bill to Improve Storm Recovery Effort; Big Mistake, Top Senator Says
